content: griddle stitch mitts © 2017 kathryn perdue griddle stitch mitts materials ‣ 1 skein of sport-weight yarn i used premier yarns serenity garden sport in earth ‣ 3 75 mm crochet hook ‣ stitch marker or contrasting yarn to mark the beginning of each round gauge 10 stitches x 9 row = 2 x 2 in griddle stitch pattern size these mitts fit medium to large adult hands thicker yarn and/or larger hook can be used to create a larger size and thinner yarn and/or smaller hook can be used to create a smaller size see the project notes on the last page for additional sizing options for this project you should be familiar with chain slip_stitch single_crochet double_crochet working in the back and front loops and working in the round after the cuff this project is worked in the round do not join at the end of the round or turn the piece except where instructed to do so in the pattern as you work move your stitch marker up to the first stitch of each new round as you get to it make 2 mitts using the pattern on the following page abbreviations & stitches used single_crochet single_crochet us terminology double_crochet double_crochet us terminology blo back loops only flo front loops only chain chain stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch if you have any questions about this pattern or need help please feel free email your questions to <kapercrochet@gmail com> with the name of the project youʼre working on in the subject line 2 griddle stitch mitts cuff chain 13 r1 starting in the second chain from the hook single_crochet 12 chain 1 turn r2-38 in blo single_crochet across 12 chain 1 turn to connect the two ends of the cuff slip_stitch through both layers across 12 note the griddle stitch pattern is that you single_crochet in every double_crochet from the previous round and double_crochet in every single_crochet from the previous round by the nature of this stitch pattern youʼll have an odd number of stitches for each round and each round will alternate starting with a single_crochet or a double_crochet mitt chain 1 r1 single_crochet 39 st evenly around the edge of the cuff 39 r2-8 single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around without joining at the end of each round 39 alternate which stitch you start with each round to maintain the griddle stitch pattern ex r2 will be single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around r3 will be double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 around r4 will be single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around and so on r9 double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 in each of the next 2 sts double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 around for the remaining 37 sts 41 r10 single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in each of the next 4 sts single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around for the remaining 37 sts 45 r11-17 double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 around 45 alternate which
